textos_fuente.text: About - Uncork Capital Companies Team About News Thoughts Jobs F T M ¬© 2025 Uncork Capital For builders and dreamers, there are no well-worn paths. But there is a guide who‚Äôs got your back. For builders and dreamers, there are no well-worn paths. But there is a guide who‚Äôs got your back. How We Invest Uncork is a seed-stage venture capital firm with over $1.2 billion under management. In May 2025, we announced two new funds: a $225M seed fund (Uncork VIII) and a $75M opportunity fund earmarked for larger investments in mature, existing portfolio companies (Uncork Plus IV). Integrity Comes First: We value honesty, transparency, consistency, and forthrightness above all else. While we look for the right Team, large TAM (Total Addressable Market), and market Tailwinds, we recognize that early-stage companies often pivot. That‚Äôs why we prioritize founder‚Äìmarket fit above everything else. When we believe in a founder‚Äôs vision, we move quickly ‚Äî with deep conviction and a full commitment to support them through every stage of their journey. We don‚Äôt aim to be the leader, but we take pride in being the leader‚Äôs most trusted guide. We‚Äôre often the first major check on the cap table and frequently lead rounds. We invest at fair valuations, on fair terms, with complete transparency ‚Äî when your term sheets are clean, there‚Äôs nothing to hide. Our average initial investment is $2.5 million, targeting an initial ownership position between 12% and 15%. When we commit, we go beyond capital ‚Äî we open doors, leveraging our network to help fill out your round with high-quality, aligned investors who add more than just money. Founders choose Uncork because of how we show up: with steady guidance, hard-won perspective, and meaningful support that moves the needle. We stay close during the early years ‚Äî the most critical, intense, and defining period in a company‚Äôs life. As new investors join and boards evolve, we make space when it‚Äôs time, but we never disappear. When others lose their conviction or composure, we remain steady and engaged. Just ask our founders. Our commitment is for the long haul. We offer perspective and support whenever it‚Äôs needed ‚Äî even when the advice is tough to hear. The trust we build endures. Many of the most successful founders we‚Äôve backed have chosen to partner with us again ‚Äî for their next venture, and the one after that. What We Invest In We have a rich history of backing new ideas across the tech landscape, long before they become obvious. From tools that help CTOs and developers sleep at night to virtual prayer communities and AI-generated content detection ‚Äî heck, we even invest in satellites and lab-grown diamonds. B2B Applications & Services We invest in the platforms and services that power modern business ‚Äî built to intelligently optimize, automate, and accelerate growth. Human Interest provides affordable, full-service retirement plans tailored to businesses of all sizes. GPTZero an AI detector for checking whether a document was written by a large language model such as ChatGPT. Carrot Fertility is a global healthcare platform helping millions worldwide with ongoing fertility and family support. Wrapbook is the next standard in payroll and production accounting for the entertainment industry. Front an AI-powered customer operations platform that enables teams to streamline communication and provide exceptional service at scale. DevTools, Infra & Security The rise of modern infrastructure and developer tools has redefined what‚Äôs possible, making it faster, cheaper, and more efficient to create software from the ground up. Today, companies of every size and stage can harness the power of AI to build, deploy, and operate with the sophistication once reserved for the world‚Äôs leading tech organizations. We invest in the platforms and services driving this shift ‚Äî the ones turning complexity into leverage and giving ambitious teams the tools to scale with confidence. LaunchDarkly helps software teams build better software, faster. SendGrid is an email delivery platform that processes more than 134 billion emails each month for more than 58 thousand customers. Tailscale is building the new internet: trusted, human-scale networks that just, well, work. Coder is the open-source platform that brings human developers and AI coding agents together in context-rich environments on your own enterprise infrastructure. Consumer Services & Marketplaces Consumer and business marketplace platforms that turn attention into community and community into durable, scalable business. With strong network effects and clear paths to scale, they‚Äôre built to grow fast, create lasting value, and be tough to displace. ClassDojo fosters stronger connections and better communication between teachers, parents, and students, both in and out of the classroom. Poshmark‚Äôs fashion buyers-sellers create a virtuous cycle where users sell, feel the love, and buy again and again. Hallow is the leading Catholic meditation, prayer & sleep app, helping millions globally feel closer to their religion. Frontier Tech Cutting-edge technology that challenges your assumptions and changes the way you look at the world. We continue to push the boundaries, investing in high-alpha opportunities in areas like space, robotics, silicon, quantum, and hardware that tackle large markets with fresh, unconventional approaches. Loft Orbital is a space infrastructure company that provides a simple, fast, and reliable way to deploy missions to low Earth orbit. Fitbit pioneered wearables by giving consumers actionable insights to manage their health. Focal Systems takes the power of deep learning computer vision and applies it to brick-and-mortar retail to automate and optimize stores. Lumina is building all-electric autonomous construction vehicles, starting with a bulldozer ($80B to $120B are spent on excavation in the US annually) Presso is an AI-robotics company revolutionizing garment care with its on-demand, low-carbon, express garment care machines. Are you building something futuristic that doesn‚Äôt neatly fit in a bucket? We should talk. /04 /04 How We Work Yes, cash matters. But founders don‚Äôt choose Uncork just for the check. They choose us because of how we show up: steady, honest, and fully in it. We bring real perspective, hard-won through years of building, backing, and navigating the unknown. We know how much the early days matter. We help where it counts. This is how we work. Direct. Committed. Founder-first. Always. No Playbook. No Bullshit. Just Partnership Every startup is different. We won‚Äôt hand you a formula. Instead, we collaborate one-on-one to help you build the version of your company only you can build. We offer tailored support, adapt alongside you, and connect you with trusted experts from our network. We say what we mean: our feedback is honest, direct, and always in service of your long-term success. A Team of Venture Ecosystem Insiders We help you raise the right money, from the right people, at the right time. Our team stays tapped into what matters at other VC firms‚Äîpeople, pace, and priorities‚Äîso you can frame your story and raise your next round with confidence. When It Hits the Fan Things will go sideways. Something breaks. A PR meltdown. Co-founders clash. A container gets held in customs. We've seen it all. When it gets messy, we don‚Äôt flinch. We lean in. You can count on us to listen, strategize, and stay with you through the hard parts. Talent: The Real Edge A strong early team accelerates everything. We help you build it. We advise on hires, coach you through executive decisions, and help you shape a culture that scales. We bring pattern recognition, and we show up in the details. Platform & Community At Uncork Capital, we believe founders are the driving force behind innovation, and one of our core missions is to help them bring their visionary ideas to life. Through carefully curated events ‚Äî from intimate dinners and curated conversations to large-scale summits ‚Äî we foster meaningful connections and encourage the exchange of ideas. Our expanding library of founder-focused playbooks provides actionable insights and proven strategies to address key challenges at every stage of company building. We pride ourselves on supporting entrepreneurs through every milestone, from funding announcements and contract negotiations to hiring decisions and beyond. Every member of our team serves as a dedicated resource for Uncork founders, and we actively tap into the broader Uncork Community ‚Äî a network of founders, investors, advisors, and top-tier service providers ‚Äî to deliver comprehensive, hands-on support to our portfolio companies. The Uncork platform has been developed over the years thanks to our strategic partnership with Goodwin & Silicon Valley Bank Reaching Out Most founders find us through our network: other founders, co-investors, operators, and accelerators. Can‚Äôt find a warm intro? No problem. Send your pitch to: pitches@uncorkcapital.com. If it‚Äôs a fit, we‚Äôll be in touch. Our History Uncork Capital has been backing bold founders at the seed-stage since before seed was a category. We started in 2004, raised one of the first institutional seed funds in 2007, and have since invested in 275+ companies ‚Äî with 100+ outcomes that have collectively generated $59B of enterprise value and, yes, a few total wipeouts (because that‚Äôs part of the journey). Our companies have raised more than $8B in follow-on capital from the world‚Äôs best venture capital firms. Today, we‚Äôre in the final stages of investing out of our $200M seed fund (Uncork VII) and a $200M opportunity fund (Plus III) for breakout winners.  And on May 1st, 2025, we announced the raise of a $225M seed fund (Uncork VIII) and a $75M opportunity fund (Plus IV) that we will deploy over the next three years. Read our announcement here. Want to get to know our our team better?

What is Uncorked Kitchen & Wine Bar? An Interview with the Founders In-Person Events Wine Bar Private Events Book an event 8171 South Chester Street, Suite A, Centennial, CO (720) 907 3838 Login ‚ò∞ In-Person Events Date Nights Cooking Events Baking Classes Wine Tastings & Events Family Cooking Classes Kid/Teen Camps Kid/Teen Birthdays Gift Cards Wine Bar Wine Tastings & Events Wine Bar Menu Reservations Gift Cards Private Events About Uncorked Our Team FAQs Hours & Directions Blog & Press Vendor Partners Book An Event In-Person Events Date Nights Cooking Events Baking Classes Wine Tastings & Events Family Cooking Classes Kid/Teen Camps Kid/Teen Birthdays Gift Cards Wine Bar Wine Tastings & Events Wine Bar Menu Reservations Gift Cards Private Events About Uncorked Our Team FAQs Hours & Directions Blog & Press Vendor Partners What is Uncorked Kitchen & Wine Bar? Uncorked Kitchen & Wine Bar (Uncorked) co-owners, Katie Robbins the CEO and Eric Robbins the Executive Chef, want to share how they came up with their offering and explain how it‚Äôs different from other cooking classes & event spaces out there. In this interview you can learn more about their passion for providing a space and experience that enhance lives and communities through cooking food and wine. WHERE IT ALL STARTED Five years ago, Katie and Eric started to plan their return to Colorado from Massachusetts. Eric, a Colorado native, always knew he wanted to come back to Colorado and raise his family here. Eric was building his career as a Chef at the time, and Katie was running a My Gym Franchise with her father back in Massachusetts. When they started to explore what they would do when they moved to Colorado, Katie knew she could not open the franchise there, since it had already been established by others in Colorado. So she started to ideate on what business she could start with her husband Eric on their return. Their entrepreneurial juices started to flow and Uncorked was established two years ago in the Fall of 2015. In this interview you will hear how they came up with the concept, and what excited them about building this startup from the ground up. They have put together an amazing team of chefs and wine bar staff to ensure as soon as you walk in the door you feel welcomed, comfortable in your surroundings, and can‚Äôt wait to come again. After two years in business, they have exceeded their own expectations and continue to enhance the offering for you, their devoted clients. HOW DID YOU DECIDE THAT UNCORKED WAS THE BUSINESS YOU WANTED TO LAUNCH IN 2015? Katie: In 2012 we were sitting around our house with Eric and my dad, and talking about what we wanted to do when we got back to Colorado. We were looking to combine our expertise and create a business we would both be passionate about. Initially we thought that with my experience with My Gym, and Eric‚Äôs experience as a chef, we could create a drop-in play space with a cafe. We realized that this didn‚Äôt make sense financially. We started to brainstorm further, and the more we thought about it, we wanted to be closer to the food and event space offering. Eric had been working with Sur La Table and developing his love of cooking and interacting with people, we wanted to enhance that offering so we came up with the concept of cooking events with a wine bar people could come hang out at, even if they were not attending an event. Eric: When we started to research where in Colorado we could build our business, we saw that South Denver was underserved. We wanted to give this area a taste of downtown‚Äôs sophistication in the southern part of Denver. HOW DID YOU COME UP WITH THE NAME? Eric: We crowdsourced it! Uncorked Kitchen came from the community and helped us build our brand, once we explained what we wanted to offer. The name embodied the wine aspect of the¬†bar as well as the energy/excitement of unleashing your culinary self in the kitchen. WHAT EXCITES YOU WHEN YOU WAKE UP AND DO THIS EVERY DAY? Katie: Working with and developing our Uncorked Kitchen team. Providing a super fun place to work, making them a second family that‚Äôs committed to our mission of providing great experiences for our community. Eric: I too, love our team. What excites me more is seeing people enjoy food and cooking. Seeing that it‚Äôs not a burden, and it‚Äôs not complicated. I love exposing people to cooking methods and seeing how they enjoy it with others, and¬†knowing how easy it will be to recreate at home. WHAT SURPRISED YOU ABOUT THIS EXPERIENCE: BUILDING A STARTUP FROM THE GROUND UP, OR SEEING YOUR VISION COME TO LIGHT? Katie: How different and personal it is building your own business vs. owning a franchise business! It showed me how much more connected you are to the success of your offering when it‚Äôs your ‚Äúbaby‚Äù. And while stressful at times, how much fun I‚Äôm having with this. Eric: The support and belief others in our community have in our concept and its success. Being able to do what I love and share it with others in a space we created. I love it when our team is as excited about what we are doing as we are; and seeing the growth we have had in the last two years, knowing we are just getting started! WHAT IS YOUR FAVORITE EVENT HOSTED AT UNCORKED? Katie : Chef Showdown event. We did it as our one year anniversary event and are making it annual. It‚Äôs a fundraiser event in which all of our chef instructors compete in an iron chef-style event, and proceeds are donated to a specified charity. This year we are donating to the American Cancer Society as a tribute to family members we have lost to cancer. Eric : Tapas and Sangrias is another favorite event we make sure is always on the calendar. WHAT MAKES AN EVENT SPECIAL? Katie: Since I manage the front of house, I get to be on the front line in designing our private and corporate events. A phone call or discussion to understand our client‚Äôs needs, the goal, the style‚Ä¶ it flexes my creativity in hosting something unique for our clients that they will not be able to achieve anywhere else. We want to make sure it reflects the client‚Äôs needs, and¬†it‚Äôs interactive and create. Eric: My team and I are responsible for building the event program and experience in the kitchen for our public events. We want to make sure we create an environment where people let their guard down, stop thinking about the rules, and get engaged. Our chefs love sharing their tricks of the trade with our clients, which brings an excitement to the table and lets them have fun. WHAT DO YOU THINK SETS YOU APART FROM OTHER COOKING EVENT SPACES OUT THERE? WHAT TRENDS ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT? Eric: We are not a cooking school or a restaurant. We offer cooking and wine experiences and want our clients to come in and make connections with others in our community. Whether it‚Äôs attending one of our adult kitchen or wine bar events, we want to provide a place for people to connect and have fun. ¬†We also selected this area of Colorado to provide a place where people can hang out that is not part of chain of restaurants. This way we can guarantee the experience will be unique to them. Katie: Offering local beers and spirits in our Wine Bar allows us to support local businesses and share their amazing offering with our clients. We update our bar menu seasonally to make sure our clients have something new to try when they return. Our wine flights and tastings are also a unique offering in the area. WE LOVE SEEING THE KIDS PROGRAMS, WHICH SEEMS TO ALIGN WITH KATIE‚ÄôS EXPERIENCE OFFERING PROGRAMS FOR CHILDREN. WHAT IS THE BEST PART OF THE PROGRAMS FOR KIDS, FOR YOU AS OWNERS? Katie: We‚Äôre a family driven business. The kids are so excited to get involved and show their parents what they‚Äôve learned. They get excited about participating! Eric: The parents appreciate that we‚Äôre giving their children fundamental skills for life and an opportunity to feed their family. When we hear from the parents after their kids have been in one of our programs, they share how excited their child was to be able to serve what they made. That brings a huge smile to my face ‚Äì every time I hear that a different connection is being made at the dinner table at home. YOU HAVE TWO KIDS UNDER THE AGE OF FIVE. WHAT DO YOUR KIDS THINK OF THE BUSINESS? Katie: It‚Äôs a family business. Everyone on the staff knows the kids. McKenna spent her first six months in what is now our event space, playing with her nanny. Eric: Carver calls class ‚ÄúChef class‚Äù. ¬†He refers to this as ‚Äúthe business‚Äù and says ‚ÄúMy daddy is a chef.‚Äù Carver loves to help and be involved in the kitchen. WHAT DO YOU WANT TO BE REMEMBERED FOR? WHAT MARK DO YOU HOPE UNCORKED LEAVES ON THE COMMUNITY YOU ATTRACT IN? Both: We want to be remembered for making home cooking enjoyable and attainable, and for providing incredible, memorable experiences as soon as you walk through our doors. We want to be the first place people think of to host their events. We want to help kids grow their confidence in the kitchen and find new ways to connect with their friends and family. We want to build a legacy business for our kids to see this place as a second home when they want a creative outlet and to connect with their community. We want our staff to feel as though they are part of our Uncorked family and grow with us. We are excited to go from the ‚Äústartup‚Äù phase of our business into the ‚Äúgrown up‚Äù phase and can‚Äôt wait to share what we have planned for 2018 as we grow the business. Katie and Eric lead from the heart and it shows. Their efforts to build Uncorked Kitchen and Wine Bar to where it is today, and the plans they have for the future is so excited to witness! You have to see it for yourself. The Uncorked Wine Bar ‚Äì with its spectacular views of the mountains ‚Äì is open Tuesday through Saturday from 3:00 ‚Äì 10:00 PM MST. Happy Hour is served from 3:00 ‚Äì 6:00 PM MST Tuesday through Friday. If you would like to host your own private or corporate event at Uncorked, please¬†submit this form¬†and a member of the Uncorked team will help you design your event. To purchase a seat in a public event, click here to check out the calendar. About Us ‚Äì Uncorked Adventures The long ride Home About Us Press Writings Donate The long ride Menu The long ride Home About Us Press Writings Donate The long ride At UnCorked Adventures we believe there is an incredible untapped potential in everyone. OUR MISSION AND PHILOSOPHY Our mission is to help people live better with Parkinson's disease while we work together to find a cure UnCorked Adventures Founder & chairman Bill Bucklew Bill learned in 2012 that he had Parkinsons Disease, after 7 years of misdiagnosis. Immediately deciding to embrace it enabled him to engage with the community to raise awareness and research funding towards a cure and advance science by donating his body and resources to multiple clinical trials, which continue to this day. Bill has had great success in slowing the disease‚Äôs progression through regular exercise and key lifestyle changes, along the way, challenging what the worlds foremost experts deemed possible. Bill has walked across the United States and Great Britain, completed an Ironman and the longest ski ultramarathon, run all the Worlds Major Marathons in a row, climbed Mt. Kilimanjaro, Assembled a team of PWP to complete the grueling Blue Ridge Relay, completed 11 triathlons and more than 40 marathons and continues to develop and train for new challenges in 2023 and 2024. Bill has had the great honor of traveling the world, sharing his story on the incredible impact upon his life that a positivity of purpose and holistic wellness has had.¬† Bill lives with his wife and family in the Northern suburbs of Chicago. Meet Our Incredible Team The Team UnCorked Adventures is an¬†all volunteer team, who are passionate to challenge the status quo, to make the world a better place, striving to discover our true capabilities in the process. Treasurer Heidi Heidi, Bill‚Äôs wife, is a founding member of UnCorked and a founding member of the first local chapter of the National Charity League and she is also a CPA.¬† Heidi completed her first marathon in 2022 by running New York and has run numerous other races, including the Chicago half marathon and countless 5k‚Äôs. Vice President Kristy Kristy is a founding member of UnCorked and has been active, both on the administration and participatory side.¬† Kristy expects to finish completing all the world major marathons in Tokyo next March, and has qualified and ran the Boston Marathon multiple times, among others.¬† Kristy lives with her husband and four daughters in the northern suburbs of Chicago. Director Steve Steve is a founding member of UnCorked and is extremely active, he loves to take long walks with his dog Nico, cycle and paddle board in the summer and has a passion for live music that has him bouncing around the World to see some of his favorite bands.¬† Steve lives with his two daughters in the northern suburbs of Chicago. Director steve Steve has an unrivaled energy and passion for life and is a great connector of people.¬† Steve is always willing to participate in almost anything and that includes endurance events.¬† He has completed the American Birkebeiner, multiple triathlons, mid-distance races and numerous 5k‚Äôs. Steve lives with his wife and two daughters in the Northern suburbs of Chicago Director Peter Peter began fundraising and exercising soon after his diagnosis in 2018. Having never run a distance over a 5K in his life, Peter committed to running the New York marathon in November of the same year, which he did successfully. Peter continues to challenge himself by running all the world majors and had an exercise streak of 700+ days in a row Director Mark Mark is a founding member of UnCorked and has Parkinson‚Äôs in his immediate family. Mark is an incredible cook, but can be caught eating extremely healthy during the week and stays fit by doing Matrix workout routines and running.¬† Mark has also been known to compete in triathlons and five 5k‚Äôs.¬† Mark lives with his wife and two daughters in the northern suburbs of Chicago. ‚ÄúOnly those who will risk going to far, can possibly find out how far one can go‚Äù TS Elliot Copyright ¬© 2024 UnCorked Adventures All Rights Reserved Phone: (773) 263-5026 Email: uncorkedadventures@outlook.com Pin It on Pinterest Loading Comments... Uncork Capital - Jeff Clavier Companies Team About News Thoughts Jobs F T M ¬© 2025 Uncork Capital Jeff Clavier Founding Partner Jeff began advising and investing in early stage tech startups more than 25 years ago after first working as a CTO for a fintech startup in France. He founded Uncork Capital in 2004 (then called SoftTech VC) to serve an unmet need of startup founders: active support and capital for companies in their first 18 months of life. Over the years, Jeff brought on partners with diverse backgrounds and networks; together they have invested in 280+ companies. With equal doses of humor, candor and hustle, Jeff works hard to help guide his companies through the most critical early stages. He is often the first large check, as well as the longest relationship, for the founding team. Jeff has supported multiple companies that have reached successful outcomes, including Fitbit (NYSE:FIT); Sendgrid (NYSE:SEND, Twilio); Eventbrite (NYSE:EB); Postmates (Uber); Poshmark (NASD:POSH); Mint (Intuit); Brightroll (Yahoo); LiveRamp (Acxiom); Wildfire (Google); Sapho (Citrix); Vungle (Blackrock); Docsend (Dropbox) and Poka (IFS). The founders of his most successful companies have a few things in common: a clear vision for their product or industry, an understanding of the dynamics of their market, smarts and determination. It was never easy: each of them almost failed multiple times, but pushed through adversity to make it happen. His current investments include ClassDojo, DroneDeploy, Vidyard, Front, Shippo, Carrot Fertility, and Memfault. He is a board director at Loft Orbital, Inscribe, Messari, Usergems, and a few still-stealth startups. Jeff was born, raised, and educated in France. He graduated from Universit√© Paris Descartes with an MS in Computer Science and a degree in Distributed Computing. He was an early employee at a fintech startup called Effix, where he started as a developer and became its CTO. Reuters acquired Effix, and Jeff moved into product development and leadership roles across the company. Yes... Pur Noire Houston Is Closing‚Ä¶ Temporarily

The building that houses our Houston tasting room was sold, and it‚Äôs being torn down.

For the past six months I‚Äôve dreaded writing this post, but here we are.

We built Pur Noire from scratch. Bootstrapped. Intentional. Rooted in culture and quality. We created a space where people could sip, connect, learn and relax. And now, because we don‚Äôt own the real estate it, we have to walk away from it.

But we‚Äôre not folding.

We‚Äôve finalizing a new temporary space in Midtown, so that we can keep pouring. But we also know we can‚Äôt keep building our future on someone else‚Äôs land. So, we‚Äôre doing what a lot of us were taught not to do. We‚Äôre asking for help.

We‚Äôve launched a crowdfunding campaign to raise $500,000 in two phases:
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†$250K to eliminate the SBA debt that‚Äôs holding us back
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†$250K to help purchase a permanent 4,000 sq. ft. winery right here in Houston

A space we own. A space no one can take from us. A space where we can make wine, host cultural experiences, and continue building something that matters.

If you‚Äôve ever believed in what we‚Äôre building, or believed in the idea of ownership, legacy, and creative control, this is the moment.

You can support or share the campaign here: https://lnkd.in/g2HRN2Vc We appreciate every dollar, every repost, and every word of encouragement. And if this resonates with you, I‚Äôd love to hear from you in the comments. #ownership #crowdfunding #wineculture #entrepreneurship #legacy ‚Ä¶more 177 13 Comments Like Comment Share Uncorked & Cultured reposted this Association of African American Vintners 754 followers 2mo Report this post A Toast to a True Trailblazer üç∑

After nearly three decades of pioneering work in the wine industry, our beloved founder, Mac McDonald, has announced his retirement and the closing of Vision Cellars.

In his recent interview with Wine Spectator, Uncle Mac shared with signature wisdom and wit:

	‚ÄúOver 27 years ago, I started the Association of African American Vintners. I didn't start that as a Black thing. I started that to get more African Americans or people who look like me to drink wine. I didn't care if they bought my wine or not, as long as they were drinking wine. It was about the whole industry.‚Äù

Mac didn‚Äôt just make award-winning wines‚Äîhe made history. As the founder of the Association of African American Vintners (AAAV), he created a space where Black winemakers could be seen, supported, and celebrated. His vision gave rise to a vibrant and inclusive wine community that continues to grow across the country and globe.

While this marks the closing of a personal chapter, Mac‚Äôs legacy is far from over. It lives on through AAAV‚Äôs continued mission, the scholarship established by the Sonoma County Library Foundation in his name, and a newly forming 501c3 foundation in his name.

Mac, thank you for showing us what‚Äôs possible‚Äîand for making space so others could follow. We raise our glass to your impact, your legacy, and your well-earned rest.
